<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/s-and-p-nasdaq-have-their-worst-week-since-the-pandemic-began-as-risky-assets-get-pummeled?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Why didn't anyone tell us?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/s-and-p-nasdaq-have-their-worst-week-since-the-pandemic-began-as-risky-assets-get-pummeled?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Kermit staring out a window with the caption " me realizing stocks don't always go up" " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/394832358b6cc0278ce1766116c9a41b50d7ae9c-700x469.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Neal Freyman / Imgflip / Jim Henson Company </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not sure if you’ve looked at your investment portfolio recently, but…don’t. It’s been a brutal couple of weeks in the markets, particularly for riskier assets like tech and crypto that have been spooked by the Fed's pivot to hike interest rates. Let’s survey the damage.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Tech</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The tech-heavy Nasdaq has fallen deeper into “correction” territory, indicating it’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-plunge-deepens-nasdaqs-correction-11642784039?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a> at least 10% from its peak last November.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 70% of Nasdaq stocks have fallen at least 20% from a recent high, which means they’re technically in a “bear” market.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than half of Nasdaq stocks are down 40% or more, which is so egregious they don’t even have an animal name for it.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Weighing down the Nasdaq yesterday was Netflix, whose 21.8% drop was its worst day since 2012 (investors are squeamish about the company’s slower subscriber growth). But it’s not like everyone else was in a position to brag: Big Tech names like Meta and Tesla also dipped; Amazon had its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/21/amazon-stock-on-pace-for-its-worst-week-in-six-months.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst week</a> since 2018.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">Crypto</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s been an especially cold winter out on the blockchain. $1.17 trillion has been <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-21/crypto-meltdown-erases-more-than-1-trillion-in-market-value?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wiped off</a> cryptocurrencies’ market value since bitcoin’s peak in November. The token itself has fallen 40% from its all-time high and hit a six-month low yesterday. As always, blame <a href="https://twitter.com/carlquintanilla/status/1484613805900509187?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Matt Damon</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for the meme coins that became popular last year…they stopped being funny when everyone started losing money. Dogecoin, for instance, is down 80% from the record high it set before Elon Musk hosted <em>SNL</em>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">SPACs</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this inhospitable market, companies that were preparing to list on stock exchanges via SPACs are thinking twice. Seven SPACs, or blank-check companies that hunt for acquisition targets and take them public, have <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1c3eb215-b029-4c65-b660-6022113e3d54?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a> their IPOs since Jan 1.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Compare that to the SPAC frenzy of 2021, when just three SPACs pulled their IPO plans in the first 11 months of the year.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>This heavy selling of expensive, riskier assets appears to be linked to rising bond yields and the Fed’s decision to wind down its pandemic-era stimulus measures to combat spiraling inflation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next week could bring even more volatility to markets: Apple and Tesla will hope to avoid becoming Netflix 2.0 when they report earnings. And the Fed will give an update on its interest rate hike timeline at the conclusion of its meeting on Wednesday.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/intel-says-it-will-spend-at-least-usd20-billion-on-chipmaking-complex-in-ohio?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Intel is taking its talents to Ohio
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/intel-says-it-will-spend-at-least-usd20-billion-on-chipmaking-complex-in-ohio?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Intel is taking its talents to Ohio " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9e1a088acee2fa513c789f690383a25e8b0dd33f-1464x950.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>A rendering of the Ohio plant. Source: Intel. </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Intel is doing what LeBron James didn’t and making a long-term commitment to Ohio. The semiconductor giant said it’s building a massive chip complex just east of Columbus.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How massive? Well, the company will initially spend at least $20 billion on <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/21/technology/intel-chip-factories-ohio.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two plants</a>, which Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine said is the largest private-sector investment in the state’s history. But if things go well for Intel, that investment could balloon to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/technology/intel-plans-new-chip-manufacturing-site-ohio-report-2022-01-21/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to $100 billion</a> for eight fabrication plants. In that case, it would likely be the largest chipmaking complex in the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Because of semiconductors’ crucial role in so many products, from smartphones to cars, these days a chip plant isn’t just a chip plant—it’s a geopolitical flex. The debilitating chip shortage during the pandemic has highlighted the strategic importance of being able to make your own chips as a country, something the US has done much less of in the past few decades.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 1990, the US accounted for 37% of all semiconductor manufacturing. Last year it was down to 12%, after losing out to Asian countries like Taiwan and China. Intel’s investment, plus Samsung’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/23/samsung-announces-a-usd17-billion-chip-plant-in-taylor-tx?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent plan</a> to build a $17 billion plant in Taylor, TX, shows the US is on its way to clawing back market share.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/biden-US-immigration-policy-STEM-students?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The US wants your best and brightest
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/biden-US-immigration-policy-STEM-students?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="MIT and Boston from the air " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5d20de7b97ad98d69b5d060668976cbaefd7c43a-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Brooks Kraft LLC/Corbis via Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Biden administration rolled out new immigration policies that will make it a <a href="https://apnews.com/article/science-technology-international-students-engineering-9849c942cdf96553218984a529ea7e92?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">little easier</a> for international science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) students to study and work in the US. The loosening of rules was cheered on by business groups, which have argued that more immigration could help cool inflation and address the severe worker shortage.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The biggest change made yesterday adds 22 new fields—including data science and financial analytics—under the STEM umbrella, a designation that lets students work in the US for three years after they graduate rather than the one afforded to other international students.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Over the last five years, international student enrollment at US colleges has declined, in part because those students are choosing to study in other English-speaking countries like the UK and Canada—where a degree costs less, the path to becoming a citizen is clearer, and your queen rocks cool hats.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s a concerning trend since immigrants, specifically in the sciences, well…they get the job done.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>International students on temporary visas account for more than 50% of US doctoral degrees in economics, computer sciences, engineering, and math and statistics, per the National Science Board.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But China is </span><span><a href="https://ncses.nsf.gov/pubs/nsb20221/u-s-and-global-stem-education-and-labor-force?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew#international-s-e-higher-education-and-student-mobility" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gaining fast</a></span><span> and is set to pass the US as the country that generates the most STEM doctorate graduates.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the most impactful changes to immigration policy, such as making more visas available or expanding eligibility, are up to Congress to make.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/key-performance-indicators-january-22?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/key-performance-indicators-january-22?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Satellite image of the volcano eruption " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-21/image-c1b83284eb834f8e49be85feef03a21d45b0e66d-720x480-gif/tonga_goes_2022015.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Satellite image of the volcano eruption " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-21/image-c1b83284eb834f8e49be85feef03a21d45b0e66d-720x480-gif/tonga_goes_2022015.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>NOAA/NASA</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>It’s been one week since an undersea volcano erupted near the Pacific nation of Tonga, and we’re still learning more about how remarkably huge it was.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An organization that monitors atomic testing said it was </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/21/1074438703/nuclear-test-monitor-calls-tonga-volcano-blast-biggest-thing-that-weve-ever-seen?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bigger</a></span><span> than the largest nuclear detonation ever conducted.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It sparked nearly 400,000 lightning events in the hours following the eruption.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was quite literally a “once-in-a-millennium” event because it takes that volcano 900–1,000 years to fill up with magma.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I’m so sorry but my show ain’t ready.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An emotional Adele announced on social media that she had to <a href="https://twitter.com/search?q=adele" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cancel</a> her entire 24-show Las Vegas residency that was set to begin last night. She said half her team was out with Covid.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Watch: </strong>An argument that TikTok is dramatically underpaying creators. (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAZapFzpP64&t=29s" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hank Green</a>)</p>
</div>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt="The NFT space is full of bros" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fb3f11bb9da09dddd26f6dedb26f00499d811689-1500x1000.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Nifty Gateway, a leading NFT platform, male artists account for 77% of primary and secondary NFT sales. Just one woman, the pop artist Grimes, cracked the top 10 bestseller list for her whimsical NFTs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But a growing cohort of women NFT artists is breaking into the space and laying the foundation for a more equitable metaverse. Brew writer Amanda Hoover talked to those female artists—<a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/26449615.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubW9ybmluZ2JyZXcuY29tL2RhaWx5L3N0b3JpZXMvMjAyMi8wMS8xOS9qdXN0LWxpa2Utc3VwcG9ydGluZy1hLWJybz91dG1fY2FtcGFpZ249bWImdXRtX21lZGl1bT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bW9ybmluZ19icmV3Jm1pZD03ZmFlMDU5YjA5MzkyYzA3NjAwNmE0MThhYzM2YjFiOA/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Cad8a4c67?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read what they said here</a>.</p>

But whad’ya know, Peloton bounced back after Thursday’s wipeout when CEO John Foley assured employees that execs “feel good about right-sizing our production.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA third dose of either Moderna or Pfizer-BioNTech’s Covid vaccine provided \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/01/21/cdc-studies-booster-shots-omicron/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esignificant protection\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e against severe disease in the US, according to three real-world reports that dropped yesterday. One analysis showed that the boosters were 90% effective at preventing hospitalization.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nINVESTING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/s-and-p-nasdaq-have-their-worst-week-since-the-pandemic-began-as-risky-assets-get-pummeled?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhy didn't anyone tell us? \n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/21/s-and-p-nasdaq-have-their-worst-week-since-the-pandemic-began-as-risky-assets-get-pummeled?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Kermit staring out a window with the caption \"me realizing stocks don't always go up\" \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/394832358b6cc0278ce1766116c9a41b50d7ae9c-700x469.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNeal Freyman / Imgflip / Jim Henson Company \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot sure if you’ve looked at your investment portfolio recently, but…don’t. It’s been a brutal couple of weeks in the markets, particularly for riskier assets like tech and crypto that have been spooked by the Fed's pivot to hike interest rates. Let’s survey the damage.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTech\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe tech-heavy Nasdaq has fallen deeper into “correction” territory, indicating it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/netflix-plunge-deepens-nasdaqs-correction-11642784039?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e at least 10% from its peak last November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 70% of Nasdaq stocks have fallen at least 20% from a recent high, which means they’re technically in a “bear” market.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than half of Nasdaq stocks are down 40% or more, which is so egregious they don’t even have an animal name for it.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWeighing down the Nasdaq yesterday was Netflix, whose 21.8% drop was its worst day since 2012 (investors are squeamish about the company’s slower subscriber growth). But it’s not like everyone else was in a position to brag: Big Tech names like Meta and Tesla also dipped; Amazon had its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/21/amazon-stock-on-pace-for-its-worst-week-in-six-months.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworst week\u003c/a\u003e since 2018.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCrypto\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s been an especially cold winter out on the blockchain. $1.17 trillion has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-21/crypto-meltdown-erases-more-than-1-trillion-in-market-value?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewiped off\u003c/a\u003e cryptocurrencies’ market value since bitcoin’s peak in November. The token itself has fallen 40% from its all-time high and hit a six-month low yesterday. As always, blame \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/carlquintanilla/status/1484613805900509187?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMatt Damon\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for the meme coins that became popular last year…they stopped being funny when everyone started losing money. Dogecoin, for instance, is down 80% from the record high it set before Elon Musk hosted \u003cem\u003eSNL\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSPACs\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn this inhospitable market, companies that were preparing to list on stock exchanges via SPACs are thinking twice. Seven SPACs, or blank-check companies that hunt for acquisition targets and take them public, have \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/1c3eb215-b029-4c65-b660-6022113e3d54?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceled\u003c/a\u003e their IPOs since Jan 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompare that to the SPAC frenzy of 2021, when just three SPACs pulled their IPO plans in the first 11 months of the year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eThis heavy selling of expensive, riskier assets appears to be linked to rising bond yields and the Fed’s decision to wind down its pandemic-era stimulus measures to combat spiraling inflation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext week could bring even more volatility to markets: Apple and Tesla will hope to avoid becoming Netflix 2.0 when they report earnings. And the Fed will give an update on its interest rate hike timeline at the conclusion of its meeting on Wednesday.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eA rendering of the Ohio plant. Source: Intel. \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIntel is doing what LeBron James didn’t and making a long-term commitment to Ohio. The semiconductor giant said it’s building a massive chip complex just east of Columbus.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow massive? Well, the company will initially spend at least $20 billion on \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/21/technology/intel-chip-factories-ohio.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etwo plants\u003c/a\u003e, which Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine said is the largest private-sector investment in the state’s history. But if things go well for Intel, that investment could balloon to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/technology/intel-plans-new-chip-manufacturing-site-ohio-report-2022-01-21/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to $100 billion\u003c/a\u003e for eight fabrication plants. In that case, it would likely be the largest chipmaking complex in the world.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause of semiconductors’ crucial role in so many products, from smartphones to cars, these days a chip plant isn’t just a chip plant—it’s a geopolitical flex. The debilitating chip shortage during the pandemic has highlighted the strategic importance of being able to make your own chips as a country, something the US has done much less of in the past few decades.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 1990, the US accounted for 37% of all semiconductor manufacturing. Last year it was down to 12%, after losing out to Asian countries like Taiwan and China. Intel’s investment, plus Samsung’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/23/samsung-announces-a-usd17-billion-chip-plant-in-taylor-tx?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecent plan\u003c/a\u003e to build a $17 billion plant in Taylor, TX, shows the US is on
